00001 //**************************************************************************
00002 //
00003 // Filename :     flic.c
00004 //
00005 //    Purpose :   Display System for .flc and .fli Flic Files
00006 //
00007 //          This program is derived from the program decribed in the article "The 
00008 //          Flic File Format" on page 18 of the March 1993 edition of Dr. Dobb's 
00009 //          Journal. It was restructured from the top down to meet the 
00010 //          requirements of Sir-Tech. The high level routines were designed to 
00011 //          provided easy integration with existing applications. Except for a few 
00012 //          identifiers, the low level routines were not modified.
00013 //
00014 //          All of the code for these routines in contained in this file and the 
00015 //          file "flic.h".
00016 //
00017 // Modification history :
00018 //
00019 //          06-09-94:???                                    - Creation
00020 //          ???:David Smoth                           - ???
00021 //          ???:Bret Rowdon for RIO/GORGE - added 640x480 SVGA support
00022 //          05-11jun96:HJH                                  - added routines for bitmap use, and 
00023 //                                                                        other utilities
00024 //    08-May-97   ARM       Adapted for Win95 Standard Gaming Platform
00025 //
00026 //**************************************************************************
00027

00074 //**************************************************************************
00075 //
00076 // screen_put_dot
00077 //
00078 //          Set one dot.
00079 //
00080 // Parameter List :
00081 // Return Value :
00082 // Modification history :
00083 //
00084 //**************************************************************************
00085 
00086 static void screen_put_dot(FlicScreen *s, int x, int y, Pixel color)
00087 {
00088       // First clip it.
00089       if (x < 0 || y < 0 || x >= s->width || y >= s->height)
00090             return;
00091 
00092       // Then set it.
00093       s->pixels[(unsigned)(s->height-y-1) * s->width + x] = color;
00094 }
00095 
00096 //**************************************************************************
00097 //
00098 // line_clip
00099 //
00100 //          Clip a horizontal line segment so that it fits on the screen.
00101 //          Return FALSE if clipped out entirely.
00102 //
00103 // Parameter List :
00104 // Return Value :
00105 // Modification history :
00106 //
00107 //**************************************************************************
00108 
00109 static Boolean line_clip(FlicScreen *s, int *px, int *py, int *pwidth)
00110 {
00111       int x = *px;
00112       int y = *py;
00113       int width = *pwidth;
00114       int xend = x + width;
00115 
00116       if (y < 0 || y >= s->height || xend < 0 || x >= s->width)
00117             return FALSE;     /* Clipped off screen. */
00118       if (x < 0)
00119       {
00120             *pwidth = width = width + x;        /* and shortens width. */
00121             *px = 0;
00122       }
00123       if (xend > s->width)
00124       {
00125             *pwidth = width = width - (xend - s->width);
00126       }
00127       if (width < 0)
00128             return FALSE;
00129       return TRUE;
00130 }
00131 
00132 //**************************************************************************
00133 //
00134 // oldscreen_copy_seg
00135 //
00136 //          Copy pixels from memory into screen.
00137 //
00138 // Parameter List :
00139 // Return Value :
00140 // Modification history :
00141 //
00142 //**************************************************************************
00143 
00144 static void oldscreen_copy_seg(FlicScreen *s, int x, int y, Pixel *pixels, int count)
00145 {
00146       Pixel *pt;
00147       //int xend;
00148       int unclipped_x = x;
00149       int dx;
00150 
00151       // First let's do some clipping.
00152       if (!line_clip(s, &x, &y, &count))
00153             return;
00154 
00155       dx = x - unclipped_x;   // Clipping change in start position.
00156       if (dx != 0)
00157             pixels += dx;                 // Advance over clipped pixels.
00158 
00159       // Calculate start screen address.
00160       //pt = s->pixels + (unsigned)y * (unsigned)s->width + (unsigned)x;
00161       pt = s->pixels + (unsigned)(s->height-y-1) * (unsigned)s->width + (unsigned)x;
00162 
00163       // Copy pixels to display.
00164       while (--count >= 0)
00165             *pt++ = *pixels++;
00166 }
00167 
00168 //**************************************************************************
00169 //
00170 // screen_repeat_one
00171 //
00172 //                Draw a horizontal line of a solid color
00173 //
00174 // Parameter List :
00175 //
00176 //          FlicScreen  *s          -> screen to write to
00177 //          int               x           -> x position to write to
00178 //          int               y           -> y position to write to
00179 //          Pixel             color -> colour to write
00180 //          int               count -> how many times to write
00181 //
00182 // Return Value :
00183 //
00184 // Modification history :
00185 //
00186 //                01jun96:HJH       -> reversed the screen up and down so that the 
00187 //                                                    bitmaps wouldn't come out upside down (I put in
00188 //                                                    the "s->height -")
00189 //
00190 //**************************************************************************
00191 
00192 static void screen_repeat_one(FlicScreen *s, int x, int y, Pixel color, int count)
00193 {
00194       Pixel *pt;
00195 
00196       // First let's do some clipping.
00197       if (!line_clip(s, &x, &y, &count))
00198             return;
00199 
00200       // Calculate start screen address.
00201       pt = s->pixels + (unsigned)(s->height-y-1) * (unsigned)s->width + (unsigned)x;
00202 
00203       // Repeat pixel on display.
00204       while (--count >= 0)
00205             *pt++ = color;
00206 }
00207 
00208 //**************************************************************************
00209 //
00210 // screen_repeat_two
00211 //
00212 //          Repeat 2 pixels count times on screen.
00213 //
00214 // Parameter List :
00215 // Return Value :
00216 // Modification history :
00217 //
00218 //**************************************************************************
00219 
00220 static void screen_repeat_two(FlicScreen *s, int x, int y, Pixels2 pixels2, int count)
00221 {
00222       Pixels2 *pt;
00223       int is_odd;
00224 
00225       // First let's do some clipping.
00226       count <<= 1;            // Convert from word to pixel count.
00227       if (!line_clip(s, &x, &y, &count))
00228             return;
00229       is_odd = (count&1);     // Did it turn odd after clipping?  Ack!
00230       count >>= 1;                  // Convert back to word count.
00231 
00232       // Calculate start screen address.
00233       pt = (Pixels2 *)(s->pixels + (unsigned)(s->height-y-1) * (unsigned)s->width + (unsigned)x);
00234 
00235       while (--count >= 0)    // Go set screen 2 pixels at a time.
00236             *pt++ = pixels2;
00237 
00238       if (is_odd)                   // Deal with pixel at end of screen if needed.
00239       {
00240             Pixel *end = (Pixel *)pt;
00241             *end = pixels2.pixels[0];
00242       }
00243 }
00244 
00245 //**************************************************************************
00246 //
00247 // screen_put_colors
00248 //
00249 //          Set count colors in color map starting at start.  RGB values
00250 //          go from 0 to 255.
00251 //
00252 // Parameter List :
00253 //
00254 //          FlicScreen  *s                      -> screen data
00255 //          int               start             -> start position
00256 //          Colour                  *colors           -> the colors, of course
00257 //          int               count             -> how many
00258 //
00259 // Return Value :
00260 // Modification history :
00261 //
00262 //**************************************************************************
00263 
00264 static void screen_put_colors(FlicScreen *s, int start, Colour *colors, int count)
00265 {
00266       int end = start + count;
00267       int ix;
00268 
00269       for (ix = start; ix < end; ++ix)
00270       {
00271             FlicPal[ix*3]=colors->r>>2;
00272             FlicPal[ix*3+1]=colors->g>>2;
00273             FlicPal[ix*3+2]=colors->b>>2;
00274             ++colors;
00275       }
00276 }
00277 
00278 //**************************************************************************
00279 //
00280 // screen_put_colors_64
00281 //
00282 //          Set count colors in color map starting at start.  RGB values
00283 //          go from 0 to 64. */
00284 //
00285 // Parameter List :
00286 //
00287 //          FlicScreen  *s                      -> screen data
00288 //          int               start             -> start position
00289 //          Colour                  *colors           -> the colors, of course
00290 //          int               count             -> how many
00291 //
00292 // Return Value :
00293 // Modification history :
00294 //
00295 //**************************************************************************
00296 
00297 static void screen_put_colors_64(FlicScreen *s, int start, Colour *colors, int count)
00298 {
00299       int end = start + count;
00300       int ix;
00301 
00302       for (ix = start; ix < end; ++ix)
00303       {
00304             FlicPal[ix*3]=colors->r;
00305             FlicPal[ix*3+1]=colors->g;
00306             FlicPal[ix*3+2]=colors->b;
00307 
00308             ++colors;
00309       }
00310 }
00311 
00312 //**************************************************************************
00313 //
00314 // decode_byte_run
00315 //
00316 //          Byte-run-length decompression.
00317 //
00318 // Parameter List :
00319 //
00320 //          Uchar *data       -> data to be decoded
00321 //          Flic  *flic       -> flic data containing where to decode to
00322 //
00323 // Return Value :
00324 // Modification history :
00325 //
00326 //**************************************************************************
00327 
00328 static void decode_byte_run(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic)
00329 {
00330       int x,y;
00331       int width = flic->head.width;
00332       int height = flic->head.height;
00333       int psize;  // was char -> HJH
00334       Char  *cpt = (Char *)data;
00335       int end;
00336 
00337       y = flic->yoff;
00338       end = flic->xoff + width;
00339       while (--height >= 0)
00340       {
00341             x = flic->xoff;
00342             cpt += 1;   /* skip over obsolete opcount byte */
00343             psize = 0;
00344             while ((x+=psize) < end)
00345             {
00346                   psize = (char)(*cpt++);
00347                   if (psize >= 0)
00348                   {
00349                         screen_repeat_one(&flic->screen, x, y, *cpt++, psize);
00350                   }
00351                   else
00352                   {
00353                         psize = -psize;
00354                         oldscreen_copy_seg(&(flic->screen),(long) x,(long) y, (unsigned char *)cpt, (long)psize);
00355                         cpt += psize;
00356                   }
00357             }
00358             y++;
00359       }
00360 }
00361 
00362 //**************************************************************************
00363 //
00364 // decode_delta_fli
00365 //
00366 //          Fli style delta decompression.
00367 //
00368 // Parameter List :
00369 //
00370 //          Uchar *data       -> data to be decoded
00371 //          Flic  *flic       -> flic data containing where to decode to
00372 //
00373 // Return Value :
00374 // Modification history :
00375 //
00376 //**************************************************************************
00377 
00378 static void decode_delta_fli(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic)
00379 {
00380       int xorg = flic->xoff;
00381       int yorg = flic->yoff;
00382       Short  *wpt = (Short  *)data;
00383       Uchar  *cpt = (Uchar  *)(wpt + 2);
00384       int x,y;
00385       Short lines;
00386       Uchar opcount;
00387       Char psize;
00388 
00389       y = yorg + *wpt++;
00390       lines = *wpt;
00391       while (--lines >= 0)
00392       {
00393             x = xorg;
00394             opcount = *cpt++;
00395             while (opcount > 0)
00396             {
00397                   x += *cpt++;
00398                   psize = *cpt++;
00399                   if (psize < 0)
00400                   {
00401                         psize = -psize;
00402                         screen_repeat_one(&flic->screen, x, y, *cpt++, psize);
00403                         x += psize;
00404                         opcount-=1;
00405                   }
00406                   else
00407                   {
00408                         oldscreen_copy_seg(&(flic->screen), (long)x, (long)y, (unsigned char *)cpt,(long) psize);
00409                         cpt += psize;
00410                         x += psize;
00411                         opcount -= 1;
00412                   }
00413             }
00414             y++;
00415       }
00416 }
00417 
00418 //**************************************************************************
00419 //
00420 // decode_delta_flc
00421 //
00422 //          Flc-style delta decompression.  The data is word oriented though
00423 //          a lot of the control info (how to skip, how many words to
00424 //          copy) are byte oriented still to save space.
00425 //
00426 // Parameter List :
00427 //
00428 //          Uchar *data       -> data to be decoded
00429 //          Flic  *flic       -> flic data containing where to decode to
00430 //
00431 // Return Value :
00432 // Modification history :
00433 //
00434 //**************************************************************************
00435 
00436 static void decode_delta_flc(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic)
00437 {
00438       int xorg = flic->xoff;
00439       int yorg = flic->yoff;
00440       int width = flic->head.width;
00441       int x,y;
00442       Short lp_count;
00443       Short opcount;
00444       int psize;
00445       union {Short  *w; Uchar  *ub; Char  *b; Pixels2  *p2;} wpt;
00446       int lastx;
00447 
00448 
00449       lastx = xorg + width - 1;
00450       wpt.ub = data;
00451       lp_count = *wpt.w++;
00452       y = yorg;
00453       goto LPACK;
00454 
00455 SKIPLINES:  /* Advance over some lines. */
00456       y -= opcount;
00457 
00458 LPACK:            /* do next line */
00459       if ((opcount = *wpt.w++) >= 0)
00460             goto DO_SS2OPS;
00461       if( ((Ushort)opcount) & 0x4000) /* skip lines */
00462             goto SKIPLINES;
00463       screen_put_dot(&flic->screen,(Uchar)opcount,lastx,(Pixel)y); /* put dot at eol with low byte */
00464       if((opcount = *wpt.w++) == 0)
00465       {
00466             ++y;
00467             if (--lp_count > 0)
00468                   goto LPACK;
00469             goto OUTT;
00470       }
00471 DO_SS2OPS:
00472       x = xorg;
00473 
00474 PPACK:                        /* do next packet */
00475       x += *wpt.ub++;
00476       psize = *wpt.b++;
00477       if ((psize += psize) >= 0)
00478       {
00479             oldscreen_copy_seg(&(flic->screen), (long)x, (long)y, (unsigned char *)wpt.ub,(long) psize);
00480             x += psize;
00481             wpt.ub += psize;
00482             if (--opcount != 0)
00483                   goto PPACK;
00484             ++y;
00485             if (--lp_count > 0)
00486                   goto LPACK;
00487       }
00488       else
00489       {
00490             psize = -psize;
00491             screen_repeat_two(&flic->screen, x, y, *wpt.p2++, psize>>1);
00492             x += psize;
00493             if (--opcount != 0)
00494                   goto PPACK;
00495             ++y;
00496             if (--lp_count > 0)
00497                   goto LPACK;
00498       }
00499 OUTT:
00500       return;
00501 }
00502 
00503 //**************************************************************************
00504 //
00505 // decode_black
00506 //
00507 //          Decode a BLACK chunk.  Set frame to solid color 0 one
00508 //          line at a time.
00509 //
00510 // Parameter List :
00511 //
00512 //          Uchar *data       -> data to be decoded
00513 //          Flic  *flic       -> flic data containing where to decode to
00514 //
00515 // Return Value :
00516 // Modification history :
00517 //
00518 //**************************************************************************
00519 
00520 static void decode_black(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic)
00521 {
00522       Pixels2 black;
00523       int i;
00524       int height = flic->head.height;
00525       int width = flic->head.width;
00526       int x = flic->xoff;
00527       int y = flic->yoff;
00528 
00529       black.pixels[0] = black.pixels[1] = 0;
00530       for (i=0; i<height; ++i)
00531       {
00532             screen_repeat_two(&flic->screen, x, y+i, black, width/2);
00533             if (width & 1)    /* if odd set last pixel */
00534                   screen_put_dot(&flic->screen, x+width-1, y+i, 0);
00535       }
00536 }
00537 
00538 //**************************************************************************
00539 //
00540 // decode_literal
00541 //
00542 //          Decode a LITERAL chunk.  Just copy data to screen one line at
00543 //          a time.
00544 //
00545 // Parameter List :
00546 //
00547 //          Uchar *data       -> data to be decoded
00548 //          Flic  *flic       -> flic data containing where to decode to
00549 //
00550 // Return Value :
00551 // Modification history :
00552 //
00553 //**************************************************************************
00554 
00555 static void decode_literal(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic)
00556 {
00557       int i;
00558       int height = flic->head.height;
00559       int width = flic->head.width;
00560       int x = flic->xoff;
00561       int y = flic->yoff;
00562 
00563       for (i=0; i<height; ++i)
00564       {
00565             oldscreen_copy_seg(&(flic->screen),(long) x,(long)(y+i), (unsigned char *)data,(long) width);
00566             data += width;
00567       }
00568 }

00571 typedef void ColorOut(FlicScreen *s, int start, Colour *colors, int count);
00572       /* This is the type of output parameter to our decode_color below.
00573        * Not coincedently screen_put_color is of this type. */
00574 
00575 
00576 //**************************************************************************
00577 //
00578 // decode_color
00579 //
00580 //          Decode color map.  Put results into output.  The two color
00581 //          compressions are identical except for whether the RGB values
00582 //          are 0-63 or 0-255.  Passing in an output that does the appropriate
00583 //          shifting on the way to the real pallete lets us use the same
00584 //          code for both COLOR_64 and COLOR_256 compression.
00585 //
00586 // Parameter List :
00587 //
00588 //          Uchar             *data             -> data to decode
00589 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic 
00590 //          ColorOut          *output           -> place to put decoded data
00591 //
00592 // Return Value :
00593 // Modification history :
00594 //
00595 //**************************************************************************
00596 
00597 static void decode_color(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic, ColorOut *output)
00598 {
00599       int start = 0;
00600       Uchar *cbuf = (Uchar *)data;
00601       Short *wp = (Short *)cbuf;
00602       Short ops;
00603       int count;
00604 
00605       ops = *wp;
00606       cbuf += sizeof(*wp);
00607       while (--ops >= 0)
00608       {
00609             start += *cbuf++;
00610             if ((count = *cbuf++) == 0)
00611                   count = 256;
00612             (*output)(&flic->screen, start, (Colour *)cbuf, count);
00613             cbuf += 3*count;
00614             start += count;
00615       }
00616 }
00617 
00618 //**************************************************************************
00619 //
00620 // decode_color_256
00621 //
00622 //          Decode COLOR_256 chunk.
00623 //
00624 // Parameter List :
00625 //
00626 //          Uchar             *data             -> data to decode
00627 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00628 //
00629 // Return Value :
00630 // Modification history :
00631 //
00632 //**************************************************************************
00633 
00634 static void decode_color_256(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic)
00635 {
00636       decode_color(data, flic, screen_put_colors);
00637 }
00638 
00639 //**************************************************************************
00640 //
00641 // decode_color_64
00642 //
00643 //          Decode COLOR_64 chunk.
00644 //
00645 // Parameter List :
00646 //
00647 //          Uchar             *data             -> data to decode
00648 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00649 //
00650 // Return Value :
00651 // Modification history :
00652 //
00653 //**************************************************************************
00654 
00655 static void decode_color_64(Uchar  *data, Flic *flic)
00656 {
00657       decode_color(data, flic, screen_put_colors_64);
00658 }
00659 
00660 //**************************************************************************
00661 //
00662 // decode_frame
00663 //
00664 //          Decode a frame that is in memory already into screen.
00665 //          Here we just loop through each chunk calling appropriate
00666 //          chunk decoder.
00667 //
00668 // Parameter List :
00669 //
00670 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00671 //          FrameHead   *frame            -> info about the frame
00672 //          Uchar             *data             -> data to decode
00673 //
00674 // Return Value :
00675 // Modification history :
00676 //
00677 //**************************************************************************
00678 
00679 static ErrCode decode_frame(Flic *flic, FrameHead *frame, Uchar  *data)
00680 {
00681       int               i;
00682       ChunkHead   *chunk;
00683 
00684       for (i=0; i<frame->chunks; ++i)
00685       {
00686             chunk = (ChunkHead  *)data;
00687             data += chunk->size;
00688             switch (chunk->type)
00689             {
00690                   case COLOR_256:
00691                         if (flic->screen.change_palette)
00692                               //decode_color_256((Uchar  *)(chunk+1), flic);
00693                               decode_color_256( (((Uchar  *)chunk) + 4 ), flic);
00694                         break;
00695                   case DELTA_FLC:
00696                         decode_delta_flc((Uchar  *)(chunk+1), flic);
00697                         break;
00698                   case COLOR_64:
00699                         if (flic->screen.change_palette)
00700                           decode_color_64((Uchar  *)(chunk+1), flic);
00701                         break;
00702                   case DELTA_FLI:
00703                         decode_delta_fli((Uchar  *)(chunk+1), flic);
00704                         break;
00705                   case BLACK_FRAME:
00706                         decode_black((Uchar  *)(chunk+1), flic);
00707                         break;
00708                   case BYTE_RUN:
00709                         decode_byte_run((Uchar  *)(chunk+1), flic);
00710                         break;
00711                   case LITERAL:
00712                         decode_literal((Uchar  *)(chunk+1), flic);
00713                         break;
00714                   default:
00715                         break;
00716             }
00717       }
00718       return 0;
00719 }
00720 
00721 static ErrCode file_read_big_block(FILE *file, char *block, Ulong size)
00722       /* Read in a big block.  Could be bigger than 64K. */
00723 {
00724       char        *pt = block;
00725       unsigned    size1;
00726 
00727       while (size != 0)
00728       {
00729             size1 = ((size > 0xFFF0) ? 0xFFF0 : size);
00730             if ( fread(pt, size1, 1, file) != 1 )
00731                   return ErrFlicRead;
00732             pt += size1;            // Advance pointer to next batch.
00733             size -= size1;          // Subtract current batch from size to go.
00734       }
00735       return 0;
00736 }
00737 
00738 //**************************************************************************
00739 //
00740 // fill_in_frame2
00741 //
00742 //          This figures out where the second frame of the flic is
00743 //          (useful for playing in a loop).
00744 //
00745 // Parameter List :
00746 //
00747 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00748 //
00749 // Return Value :
00750 // Modification history :
00751 //
00752 //**************************************************************************
00753 
00754 static ErrCode fill_in_frame2(Flic *flic)
00755 {
00756       FrameHead head;
00757       //ErrCode err;
00758 
00759       (*flic->seek)(flic, flic->head.oframe1);
00760       if ( fread(&head, sizeof(head), 1, flic->file) != 1 )
00761         return ErrFlicRead;
00762 
00763       if ( fread(&head, sizeof(head), 1, flic->file) != 1 )
00764         return ErrFlicRead;
00765 
00766       flic->head.oframe2 = flic->head.oframe1 + head.size;
00767 
00768       return 0;
00769 }
00770 
00771 //**************************************************************************
00772 //
00773 // flic_next_frame
00774 //
00775 //          Advance to next frame of flic.
00776 //
00777 // Parameter List :
00778 //
00779 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00780 //
00781 // Return Value :
00782 // Modification history :
00783 //
00784 //**************************************************************************
00785 
00786 static ErrCode flic_next_frame(Flic *flic, BOOL fDecode)
00787 {
00788       FrameHead   head;
00789       ErrCode           err = 0;
00790       long              size;
00791 
00792       if ( fread(&head, sizeof(head), 1, flic->file) != 1 )
00793         err = ErrFlicRead;
00794       else
00795       {
00796             if (head.type == FRAME_TYPE)
00797             {
00798                   size = head.size - sizeof(head);    /* Don't include head. */
00799                   if (size > 0)
00800                   {
00801                         if (size > 500000)
00802                         {
00803                               //TRACE("FLC chunk too big: %d\n",size);
00804                               //Assert(0);
00805             FastDebugMsg(String("flic_next_frame: FLC chunk too big: %d", size));
00806                               size = 64000;
00807                         }
00808                         if (!(err = file_read_big_block(flic->file, pcxbuf, size)))
00809                         {
00810                               if ( fDecode )
00811                                     err = decode_frame(flic, &head, (unsigned char *)pcxbuf);
00812                         }
00813                   }
00814             }
00815             else
00816                   err = ErrFlicBadFrame;
00817       }
00818       return err;
00819 }
00820 
00821 //**************************************************************************
00822 //
00823 // flic_check_frame
00824 //
00825 //          A dummy routine to be called for each frame.
00826 //
00827 // Parameter List :
00828 //
00829 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00830 //
00831 // Return Value :
00832 // Modification history :
00833 //
00834 //**************************************************************************
00835 
00836 static Boolean flic_check_frame(Flic *flic)
00837 {
00838   return TRUE;
00839 }
00840 
00841 //**************************************************************************
00842 //
00843 //                      File io
00844 //
00845 //**************************************************************************
00846 
00847 static ErrCode flic_open(Flic *flic, const char *filename)
00848 {
00849   return (flic->file = fopen(filename, "rb")) ? 0 : ErrFlicAccess;
00850 }
00851 
00852 static ErrCode flic_seek(Flic *flic, long offset)
00853 {
00854   return fseek(flic->file, offset, SEEK_SET) ? ErrFlicSeek : 0;
00855 }
00856 
00857 //**************************************************************************
00858 //
00859 // FlicInit
00860 //
00861 //          Initializes a flic object.
00862 //
00863 // Parameter List :
00864 //
00865 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00866 //
00867 // Return Value :
00868 // Modification history :
00869 //
00870 //**************************************************************************
00871 
00872 void FlicInit(Flic *flic, unsigned screen_width, unsigned screen_height, char change_palette, char *Buff)
00873 {
00874   flic->file = NULL;
00875   //flic->lib.names = NULL;
00876 
00877   flic->open = flic_open;  /* Set routines for single flick file access */
00878   flic->seek = flic_seek;
00879 
00880   flic->check_frame = flic_check_frame;  /* Select a dummy routine */
00881 
00882   /** Info used by low level routines */
00883 
00884   flic->screen.pixels = (unsigned char *)Buff; // (char *) 0xa0000;
00885   flic->screen.width = screen_width;
00886   flic->screen.height = screen_height;
00887   flic->screen.change_palette = change_palette;
00888 }
00889 
00890 //**************************************************************************
00891 //
00892 // FlicOpen
00893 //
00894 //          Opens a flic file or locates a flic file in a library.
00895 //
00896 // Parameter List :
00897 //
00898 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00899 //          const char  *filename   -> filename of flic to open
00900 //
00901 // Return Value :
00902 // Modification history :
00903 //
00904 //**************************************************************************
00905 
00906 ErrCode FlicOpen(Flic *flic, const char *filename)
00907 {
00908       ErrCode err;
00909 
00910       flic->xoff = flic->yoff = 0;
00911 
00912       if ( !(err = (*flic->open)(flic, filename)) )
00913       {
00914             if (fread(&flic->head, sizeof(flic->head), 1, flic->file) != 1)
00915               err = ErrFlicRead;
00916             else
00917             {
00918                   flic->name = filename;
00919 
00920                   if (flic->head.type == FLC_TYPE)
00921                   {
00922                         /* Seek frame 1. */
00923                         (*flic->seek)(flic, flic->head.oframe1);
00924                         return 0;
00925                   }
00926                   if (flic->head.type == FLI_TYPE)
00927                   {
00928                         long i;
00929                         /* Do some conversion work here. */
00930                         flic->head.oframe1 = sizeof(flic->head);
00931                         i=flic->head.speed * 1000L;
00932                         flic->head.speed = i / 70;
00933                         return 0;
00934                   }
00935                   else
00936                   {
00937                         err = ErrFlicBad;
00938                         printf("flic was bad! \n");
00939                         _getch();
00940                         exit(0);
00941                   }
00942             }
00943       }
00944 
00945       FlicClose(flic);        /* Close down and scrub partially opened flic. */
00946       return err;
00947 }
00948 
00949 //**************************************************************************
00950 //
00951 // FlicSetOrigin
00952 //
00953 //          Sets the location of the top left corner of the flic in terms of screen
00954 //          coordinates.
00955 //
00956 // Parameter List :
00957 //
00958 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00959 //          unsigned          x                       -> x-coord of origin
00960 //          unsigned          y                       -> y-coord of origin
00961 //
00962 // Return Value :
00963 // Modification history :
00964 //
00965 //**************************************************************************
00966 
00967 void FlicSetOrigin(Flic *flic, unsigned x, unsigned y)
00968 {
00969   flic->xoff = x;
00970   flic->yoff = y;
00971 }
00972 
00973 //**************************************************************************
00974 //
00975 // FlicClose
00976 //
00977 //          Closes a flic file if one is open. If a library is open, this function has
00978 //          no effect.
00979 //
00980 // Parameter List :
00981 //
00982 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic
00983 //
00984 // Return Value :
00985 // Modification history :
00986 //
00987 //**************************************************************************
00988 
00989 void FlicClose(Flic *flic)
00990 {
00991       if ( flic->file )
00992       {
00993             fclose(flic->file);
00994             flic->file = NULL;
00995       }
00996 }
00997

01116 void FlicSeekFirst(Flic *flic)
01117 {
01118 //    if (flic->head.oframe2 == 0)
01119 //          fill_in_frame2(flic);

01121       // Seek to first frame.
01122       flic_seek(flic, flic->head.oframe1);
01123 
01124       // Display first frame.
01125       //flic_next_frame(flic, TRUE);      HJH
01126       flic->status.frame_index=0;//1;     HJH
01127 }
01128 
01129 int FlicAdvance(Flic *flic, BOOL fDecode)
01130 {
01131       // Seek to second frame
01132       //(*flic->seek)(flic, flic->head.oframe2);
01133       // Loop from 2nd frame thru ring frame
01134 
01135       //    for (flic->status.frame_index=0;
01136       //           (flic->status.frame_index < (flic->head.frames-1)) ||
01137       //           ( (flic->status.frame_index < flic->head.frames) &&
01138       //           ( !max_loop || (flic->status.loop_count < (max_loop - 1))));
01139       //           ++flic->status.frame_index)
01140       //    {
01141 
01142       if(flic->status.frame_index < flic->head.frames)
01143       {
01144             flic_next_frame(flic, fDecode);
01145             flic->status.frame_index++;
01146             //memcpy(buffer, buffer2, (HSIZE*VSIZE));
01147             return(1);
01148       }
01149       else
01150             return(0);
01151 
01152       //    if (flic->check_frame && !(*flic->check_frame)(flic))
01153       //          return 0;
01154 }
01155 
01156 static void center_flic(Flic *flic)
01157       /* Set flic.xoff and flic.yoff so flic plays centered rather
01158        * than in upper left corner of display. */
01159 {
01160       flic->xoff = (flic->screen.width - (signed)flic->head.width)/2;
01161       flic->yoff = (flic->screen.height - (signed)flic->head.height)/2;
01162 }
01163 
01164 void set_flic_origin(Flic *flic, int x, int y)
01165 {
01166   flic->xoff = x;
01167   flic->yoff = y;
01168 }
01169

01171 {

01179    }

01182       {

01184             if (FlcSoundFrames[FlcSoundIndex][1] < 100)
01185             {
01186                   PlayVoc(FlcSoundFrames[FlcSoundIndex][1],-1);
01187             }
01188             else  // otherwise a raw sound data file to be streamed off of disk
01189             {

01191                   {

01193                   if (retcode == 0)
01194                         StPlay(glbPlayRate,IGNORE_AUDIO_GAPS);
01195                   }
01196             }
01197

01199             FlcSoundIndex++;

01203       {
01204             PlayXmi(FlcSoundFrames[FlcSoundIndex++][1],FALSE);
01205             XmiVolume(1,127,0);
01206       }
01207       RefreshSound();
01208 */
01209   return 1;
01210 }
01211 
01212 //**************************************************************************
01213 //
01214 // FlicStart
01215 //
01216 // Parameter List :
01217 //
01218 //          char              *filename   -> filename of flic to start processing
01219 //          char              *buffer           -> screen buffer to put data into
01220 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic 
01221 //          int               usepal            -> flag - should we use the palette? (I think)
01222 //
01223 // Return Value :
01224 // Modification history :
01225 //
01226 //**************************************************************************
01227 
01228 int FlicStart(char *filename, int width, int height, char *buffer, Flic *flic, char usepal)
01229 {
01230       FlicInit(flic, width, height, usepal, buffer);
01231 
01232       if(FlicOpen(flic, filename))
01233             return(-1);
01234 
01235       FlicSetOrigin(flic, 0, 0);
01236       FlicSeekFirst(flic);
01237       FlicAdvance(flic, TRUE);            // HJH - we go to 1st, then go process it
01238 
01239       //memcpy(buffer, buffer2, (HSIZE*VSIZE));
01240 
01241       return(0);
01242 }
01243 
01244 //**************************************************************************
01245 //
01246 // FlicStop
01247 //
01248 // Parameter List :
01249 //
01250 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic 
01251 //
01252 // Return Value :
01253 // Modification history :
01254 //
01255 //**************************************************************************
01256 
01257 void FlicStop(Flic *flic)
01258 {
01259       FlicClose(flic);
01260 }
01261 
01262 //**************************************************************************
01263 //
01264 // FlicGetStats
01265 //
01266 //          Gets statistics for the given file.
01267 //
01268 // Parameter List :
01269 //
01270 //          char              *filename         -> the flic filename
01271 //          Flic              *flic                   -> the flic 
01272 //          int               *piBufferSize     -> this function will fill in how large a
01273 //                                                                      buffer is needed to store a screen of
01274 //                                                                      this flick
01275 //          int               *piColourPalSize->this function will fill in how large
01276 //                                                                      the colour palette is
01277 //
01278 // Return Value :
01279 //
01280 //          ErrCode           ->    0 if successfull, non-zero otherwise
01281 //
01282 // Modification history :
01283 //
01284 //          05jun96:HJH -> creation
01285 //
01286 //**************************************************************************
01287 
01288 ErrCode FlicGetStats(char *filename, int width, int height, Flic *flic, int *piBufferSize, int *piColourPalSize)
01289 {
01290       ErrCode err=0;
01291       FlicInit(flic, width, height, 1, NULL);
01292 
01293       flic->xoff = flic->yoff = 0;
01294 
01295       if ( !(err = (*flic->open)(flic, filename)) )
01296       {
01297             if (fread(&flic->head, sizeof(flic->head), 1, flic->file) != 1)
01298               err = ErrFlicRead;
01299       }
01300 
01301       if ( !err && piBufferSize )
01302             *piBufferSize = flic->head.width * flic->head.height;
01303 
01304       FlicSeekChunk( flic, 0, COLOR_256, piColourPalSize );
01305       FlicClose(flic);        /* Close down and scrub partially opened flic. */
01306 
01307       return err;
01308 }
01309 
01310 //**************************************************************************
01311 //
01312 // FlicGetColourPalette
01313 //
01314 //          To get the colour palette from the given flic file.
01315 //
01316 // Parameter List :
01317 //
01318 //          char              *filename   -> the flic file to extract the palette from
01319 //          char              **ppBuffer  -> the place to put the palette
01320 //
01321 // Return Value :
01322 //
01323 //          ErrCode           ->    0 if successful, non-zero otherwise
01324 //
01325 // Modification history :
01326 //
01327 //          10jun96:HJH ->    creation
01328 //          19jun96:HJH ->    removed <<2 after colors->r/g/b
01329 //
01330 //**************************************************************************
01331 
01332 ErrCode     FlicGetColourPalette(CHAR *filename, int width, int height, CHAR **ppBuffer, INT *piNumColours)
01333 {
01334       Flic              flic;
01335       INT               iBufferSize;
01336       INT               iColourPaletteSize=0;
01337       ErrCode           err = 0;
01338       ChunkHead   *chunk = NULL;
01339       CHAR              *pcPosition;
01340 
01341       if ( FlicGetStats( filename, width, height, &flic, &iBufferSize, &iColourPaletteSize ) )
01342             err = -1;
01343 
01344       if ( piNumColours )
01345             *piNumColours = iColourPaletteSize;
01346 
01347       if ( !err && iColourPaletteSize )
01348       {
01349             FlicInit(&flic, flic.head.width, flic.head.height, 1, NULL);
01350 
01351             if(FlicOpen(&flic, filename))
01352                   return(-1);
01353 
01354             FlicSetOrigin(&flic, 0, 0);
01355             
01356             *ppBuffer   = (CHAR *)MemAlloc( iColourPaletteSize );
01357             chunk             = (ChunkHead *)FlicSeekChunk( &flic, 0, COLOR_256, NULL );
01358             pcPosition  = (CHAR *)(((BYTE *)chunk)+6);
01359 
01360             if ( chunk )
01361             {
01362                   INT               ix, end, count, start = 0;
01363                   Uchar             *cbuf = (Uchar *)pcPosition;
01364                   Short             *wp = (Short *)cbuf;
01365                   Short             ops;
01366                   Colour                  *colors;
01367 
01368                   ops = *wp;
01369                   cbuf += sizeof(*wp);
01370                   while (--ops >= 0)
01371                   {
01372                         start += *cbuf++;
01373                         if ((count = *cbuf++) == 0)
01374                               count = 256;
01375                         {
01376                               colors = (Colour *)cbuf;
01377                               end    = start + count;
01378 
01379                               for (ix = start; ix < end; ++ix)
01380                               {
01381                                     (*ppBuffer)[ix*3]  =colors->r;
01382                                     (*ppBuffer)[ix*3+1]=colors->g;
01383                                     (*ppBuffer)[ix*3+2]=colors->b;
01384                                     ++colors;
01385                               }
01386                         }
01387                         cbuf += 3*count;
01388                         start += count;
01389                   }
01390             }
01391       }
01392       else
01393       {
01394             err = -1;
01395       }
01396 
01397       return(err);
01398 }
01399 
01400 //**************************************************************************
01401 //
01402 // FlicSeekChunk
01403 //
01404 //          To seek to a particular chunk in the flic file.
01405 //
01406 // Parameter List :
01407 //
01408 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic to search
01409 //          INT               iFrame            -> frame in which to search
01410 //          ChunkTypes  eType             -> type of chunk to search for
01411 //          INT               *piChunkSize-> the function puts the size of the chunk here
01412 //
01413 // Return Value :
01414 //
01415 //          char *            -> the returned chunk
01416 //
01417 // Modification history :
01418 //
01419 //          05jun96:HJH ->    creation
01420 //
01421 //**************************************************************************
01422 
01423 CHAR *FlicSeekChunk(Flic *flic, INT iFrame, ChunkTypes eType, INT *piChunkSize)
01424 {
01425       FrameHead   head;
01426       LONG              lSize;
01427       BOOL              fFound = FALSE;
01428       ErrCode           err=0;
01429   INT       i;
01430 
01431       FlicSeekFirst(flic);
01432 
01433       for ( i=0 ; i<iFrame ; i++ )
01434             FlicAdvance(flic, FALSE);
01435 
01436       if ( fread(&head, sizeof(head), 1, flic->file) != 1 )
01437         err = ErrFlicRead;
01438       else
01439       {
01440             if (head.type == FRAME_TYPE)
01441             {
01442                   lSize = head.size - sizeof(head);   /* Don't include head. */
01443                   if (lSize > 0)
01444                   {
01445                         if (lSize > 500000)
01446                         {
01447                               _getch();
01448                               lSize = 64000;
01449                         }
01450                         if (!(err = file_read_big_block(flic->file, pcxbuf, lSize)))
01451                         {
01452                               FrameHead   *frame = &head;
01453                               Uchar             *data = (unsigned char *)pcxbuf;
01454                               int               i;
01455                               ChunkHead   *chunk;
01456 
01457                               for (i=0; i<head.chunks; ++i)
01458                               {
01459                                     chunk = (ChunkHead  *)data;
01460                                     data += chunk->size;
01461                                     if ( chunk->type == eType )
01462                                     {
01463                                           if ( piChunkSize )
01464                                                 *piChunkSize = chunk->size;
01465                                           return( ((char  *)chunk) );
01466                                     }
01467                               }
01468                         }
01469                   }
01470             }
01471             else
01472                   err = ErrFlicBadFrame;
01473       }
01474 
01475       return(NULL);
01476 }
01477 
01478 //**************************************************************************
01479 //
01480 // FlicFindByteRunBeforeFrame
01481 //
01482 //          To find the closest byte run frame before the given frame.
01483 //
01484 // Parameter List :
01485 //
01486 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic to extract data from
01487 //          INT               iFrame            -> the frame number before which to find a
01488 //                                                                byte run
01489 //
01490 // Return Value :
01491 //
01492 //          INT               ->    frame # if successful, BAD_INDEX otherwise
01493 //
01494 // Modification history :
01495 //
01496 //          19jun96:HJH ->    creation
01497 //
01498 //**************************************************************************
01499 
01500 INT FlicFindByteRunBeforeFrame(Flic *flic, INT iFrame)
01501 {
01502       INT   iRet = BAD_INDEX;
01503   INT i;
01504 
01505 
01506       for ( i=iFrame-1 ; i>=0 ; i-- )
01507       {
01508             if ( FlicSeekChunk( flic, i, BYTE_RUN, NULL ) )
01509                   return(i);
01510       }
01511 
01512       return( iRet );
01513 }
01514 
01515 //**************************************************************************
01516 //
01517 // FlicFillBitmapData
01518 //
01519 //          To put flic bitmap data for a particular frame into the given bitmap.
01520 //
01521 // Parameter List :
01522 //
01523 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic to extract data from
01524 //          INT               iPrevFrame  -> the previous frame decoded, BAD_INDEX if unknown
01525 //          INT               iFrame            -> the frame number to extract bitmap data for
01526 //          HBITMAP           hBitmap           -> place to put the bitmap data
01527 //
01528 // Return Value :
01529 //
01530 //          ErrCode           ->    0 if successful, non-zero otherwise
01531 //
01532 // Modification history :
01533 //
01534 //          10jun96:HJH ->    creation
01535 //          19jun96:HJH -> removed redundancies
01536 //                                  -> added check for iPrevFrame != (iFrame-1)
01537 //
01538 //**************************************************************************
01539 
01540 ErrCode FlicFillBitmapData( Flic *flic, INT iPrevFrame, INT iFrame, HBITMAP hBitmap )
01541 {
01542       ErrCode           err = 0;
01543       ChunkHead   *chunk = NULL;
01544       DIBSECTION  dibSection;
01545       INT               i, iStart;
01546 
01547       GetObject( hBitmap, sizeof(DIBSECTION), &dibSection );
01548 
01549       flic->screen.pixels = (Pixel *)dibSection.dsBm.bmBits;
01550 
01551       if ( iPrevFrame == BAD_INDEX || iPrevFrame != (iFrame-1) )
01552       {
01553             iStart = FlicFindByteRunBeforeFrame( flic, iFrame );
01554             if ( iStart == BAD_INDEX )
01555                   iStart = 0;
01556       }
01557       else
01558             iStart = iFrame;
01559 
01560       for ( i=iStart ; i<=iFrame ; i++ )
01561       {
01562             chunk = (ChunkHead *)FlicSeekChunk( flic, i, DELTA_FLC, NULL );
01563             if ( chunk )
01564                   decode_delta_flc( ((BYTE*)chunk)+6, flic );
01565             else
01566             {
01567                   chunk = (ChunkHead *)FlicSeekChunk( flic, i, BYTE_RUN, NULL );
01568                   if ( chunk )
01569                   {
01570                         FlicClearBitmap( hBitmap, 0 );
01571                         decode_byte_run( ((BYTE*)chunk)+6, flic );
01572                   }
01573             }
01574 
01575             flic->status.frame_index = i;
01576       }
01577 
01578       return( err );
01579 }
01580 
01581 //**************************************************************************
01582 //
01583 // FlicFillFrameData
01584 //
01585 //          To put flic frame data for a particular frame into the given bitmap.
01586 //          This is raw data. Either a byte run or deltas.
01587 //
01588 // Parameter List :
01589 //
01590 //          Flic              *flic             -> the flic to extract data from
01591 //          INT               iPrevFrame  -> the previous frame decoded, BAD_INDEX if unknown
01592 //          INT               iFrame            -> the frame number to extract bitmap data for
01593 //          CHAR              *pcBuffer   -> place to put the frame data
01594 //          INT               *piSize           -> size of buffer ; we return how many bytes
01595 //                                                                were placed in the buffer
01596 //
01597 // Return Value :
01598 //
01599 //          ErrCode           ->    0 if successful, non-zero otherwise
01600 //
01601 // Modification history :
01602 //
01603 //          03jul96:HJH ->    creation
01604 //
01605 //**************************************************************************
01606 
01607 ErrCode FlicFillFrameData(
01608       Flic  *flic,
01609       INT   iPrevFrame,
01610       INT   iFrame,
01611       CHAR  *pcBuffer,
01612       INT   *piNumBytes
01613       )
01614 {
01615       ErrCode           err = 0;
01616       ChunkHead   *chunk = NULL;
01617       INT               i, iStart, iNumBytesInBuffer;
01618 
01619       Assert(piNumBytes);
01620       //GetObject( hBitmap, sizeof(DIBSECTION), &dibSection );
01621 
01622       flic->screen.pixels = (Pixel *)pcBuffer;
01623       iNumBytesInBuffer   = *piNumBytes;
01624 
01625       if ( iPrevFrame == BAD_INDEX || iPrevFrame != (iFrame-1) )
01626       {
01627             iStart = FlicFindByteRunBeforeFrame( flic, iFrame );
01628             if ( iStart == BAD_INDEX )
01629                   iStart = 0;
01630       }
01631       else
01632             iStart = iFrame;
01633 
01634       for ( i=iStart ; i<=iFrame ; i++ )
01635       {
01636             chunk = (ChunkHead *)FlicSeekChunk( flic, i, DELTA_FLC, piNumBytes );
01637             if ( chunk )
01638             {
01639                   Assert(*piNumBytes <= iNumBytesInBuffer);
01640                   memcpy( pcBuffer, ((BYTE*)chunk)+6, *piNumBytes );
01641                   //decode_delta_flc( ((BYTE*)chunk)+6, flic );
01642             }
01643             else
01644             {
01645                   chunk = (ChunkHead *)FlicSeekChunk( flic, i, BYTE_RUN, piNumBytes );
01646                   if ( chunk )
01647                   {
01648                         Assert(*piNumBytes <= iNumBytesInBuffer);
01649                         //FlicClearBitmap( hBitmap, 0 );
01650                         memcpy( pcBuffer, ((BYTE*)chunk)+6, *piNumBytes );
01651                         //decode_byte_run( ((BYTE*)chunk)+6, flic );
01652                   }
01653             }
01654 
01655             flic->status.frame_index = i;
01656       }
01657 
01658       return( err );
01659 }
01660 
01661 //**************************************************************************
01662 //
01663 // FlicClearBitmap
01664 //
01665 //          To clear the given bitmap to a certain colour index value.
01666 //
01667 // Parameter List :
01668 //
01669 //          HBITMAP           hBitmap           -> bitmap to clear
01670 //          INT               iFrame            -> the colour index to use in clearing
01671 //
01672 // Return Value :
01673 //
01674 //          none
01675 //
01676 // Modification history :
01677 //
01678 //          11jun96:HJH ->    creation
01679 //
01680 //**************************************************************************
01681 
01682 void FlicClearBitmap( HBITMAP hBitmap, INT iColourIndex )
01683 {
01684       DIBSECTION  dibSection;
01685       INT               i;
01686 
01687       CHECKV(hBitmap);
01688 
01689       CHECKV(GetObject(hBitmap, sizeof(DIBSECTION), &dibSection));
01690       CHECKV(dibSection.dsBm.bmBits);
01691       CHECKV(dibSection.dsBm.bmHeight);
01692       CHECKV(dibSection.dsBm.bmWidth);
01693 
01694       for ( i=0 ; i<dibSection.dsBm.bmHeight*dibSection.dsBm.bmWidth ; i++ )
01695       {
01696             ((CHAR *)dibSection.dsBm.bmBits)[i] = iColourIndex;
01697       }
01698 }
